**NOW HIRING: Assistant Director of Nursing (ADON)**

***Responsibilities of an Assistant Director of Nursing (ADON):***

* Collaborate with the Director of Nursing to manage and supervise nursing staff, ensuring compliance with regulations and facility policies.

title: INTERVENTIONAL CARDIOVASCULAR TECH -Per Diem
description:
**JOB DUTIES:**

* The interventional Cardiovascular Radiology Technologist will assist physicians with all aspects of cardiac, endovascular and electrophysiology invasive procedures. Procedures include, but not limited to, diagnostic coronary catheterizations/angioplasty, endovascular diagnostics/angioplasty, balloon pump/lmpella insertions along with electrophysiology procedures such as pacemaker implantation, temporary pacemaker and loop recorder insertions.
* Responsible for preparing sterile procedure trays along with patient preparation prior to each case.

* Member of the Emergency Call Team for procedures after regularly scheduled hours. Must be onsite/in the laboratory within 30 minutes of activation.

High school diploma or equivalent


Completion of an approved school of Radiologic Technology


Preferred 2 years prior experience in a cardiac catheterization laboratory or invasive procedure area.


Familiarity with computers, hemodynamic monitoring, and sterile operative techniques.


Diagnostic Radiography License


CPR Certification

title: B2B Sales Representative
description:
B2B Sales Representative - Textile Manufacturing
Apex Mills is growing, and we're looking for a highly professional, self-starting individual with strong interpersonal skills who enjoys face-to-face customer interaction to join our Sales Team.


We are a leading American manufacturer of high-performance fabrics, knits, mesh/netting, and elastics with 80 years of experience working with Fortune 500 businesses, government agencies, and organizations of all sizes to provide business-critical fabric solutions. As a respected member of AFFOA, SEAMS, AAPN, ATA, and other organizations, we are committed to continual process and product improvement with ISO 9001:2015 OEKO-TEX Standard 100. Our fabrics are made in the USA with full traceability and transparency.


Apex Mills, with corporate and sales offices in **Inwood, NY**, manufactures innovative warp and circular knits with enhanced fabric dyeing and finishing capabilities from its state-of-the-art facilities in **Graham, NC**, and **Woolwine, VA**, with 400,000 square feet.

**While this position is remote/hybrid with travel, easy access to one of these three locations is required.**


Recent investments and expansion offer tremendous opportunities for growth. If you are a sales professional who will thrive in an environment that is collaborative, driven, friendly, customer-focused, and forward-thinking, **we will train you to excel** in our organization.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

  

Reporting to the Chief Operating Officer, the position offers an **escalating commission structure, unlimited territory, and unbridled sales potential.**

* Work with our sales team to promote collaborative solution-oriented relationships with new and existing customers.
* Regularly research industry trends to be able to make informed recommendations.
* Stay updated on industry knowledge of knitted textiles and fabric development processes to enhance expertise and contribute to personal and team success.
* Manage end-to-end sales process including prospecting, lead generation, business-to-business calling, negotiations, writing up customer orders, checking inventory status, coordinating with customer service and production departments on deliveries, and following up on order status.
* Provide ongoing support to clients, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction.
* Follow up with new leads, including new customer call-ins and web-based inquiries.
* Participate in industry trade shows.
* Regularly visit customer sites to build and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential clients, understand their needs, promote new products, and provide tailored solutions.
* Become proficient in our ERP system.

**Ideal candidates should have the following qualifications:**

* Experience or knowledge of high-performance technical textiles within the apparel, medical, military, and industrial textile sectors.
* 3-5 years of relevant sales experience.
* A Bachelor’s Degree.
* Must be willing to travel.

  

If you are energetic, ambitious, detail-oriented, and well-organized, we want to make you part of our sales team.Comprehensive benefits include Medical, Dental, and 401(k). Compensation programs commensurate with experience. Base salary range: $80,000 - 100,000 + uncapped commission structure.

**Apex Mills - Keeping Textile Jobs in America since 1943**

**APPLY NOW!**


We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

title: Assistant Behavior Intervention Specialist
description:
**On-demand pay available - Work today, get paid today!**

**Ready to join our 4,000+ employees in a career at YAI?**

Working at YAI means effecting real change in people's lives. It means going home at the end of the day knowing you have helped someone accomplish a goal. If you want a career supporting others, creatively finding solutions to life's challenges, and building a more inclusive community, YAI is the place for you!

We are hiring people for our **Western Suffolk County**  **- Dix Hills & Melville locations**. The ideal candidate should possess a wide range of skills and are eager to promote YAI's mission of supporting people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live, love, work, and learn in their communities.

**About the Position:**

The Assistant Behavior Intervention Specialist (ABIS) position blends together the Direct Support Professional (DSP) role and the clinical leadership role. ABIS works directly with people in their home, work, and daily life in varying capacities. Clinical leadership under the supervision of the BIS includes educating team members on habilitative and Behavior Support Plans, assisting with clinical assessments, ensuring data collection and providing direct feedback and education to all team members.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

· BA/BS Degree in Psychology or Human Services strongly preferred or

· Enrolled in 4-year degree in Psychology or Human Services field

· Experience working within the field of ID/DD preferred

· Valid Driver’s License

**​**

Sunday - Thursday 2:30pm - 10:30pm

On-demand pay available - Work today, get paid today!

Tuition reimbursement

Medical and dental insurance (with options for family and more extensive medical plans, as well as vision)

Paid vacation, holidays, and sick time

403(b) retirement with employer match

Life insurance and long-term disability

Discounts on travel, entertainment, wireless services, shopping, and more! Check out our Benefits page to learn more!

\\*\\*\\* YAI has implemented a mandatory vaccination policy for all employees. If hired, you will be required to obtain a COVID-19 vaccine and/or proof of vaccination pursuant to this policy from a provider of your choice, unless you are granted a reasonable accommodation based upon disability or religion pursuant to federal, state, or local law

title: Behavior Specialist
description:
**Position Purpose:**  
The Teacher/Behavior Specialist works in conjunction with other school professionals to develop individualized reinforcement strategies to assist students who exhibit challenging behavior.

**Qualifications:**

* Completes functional behavior assessments for student demonstrating challenging behaviors.
* Develops and implements individualized program for student’s IEP goals on the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis.
* Creates and trains staff in the implementation of behavior intervention plans for children with challenging behaviors.
* Plans, prepares and delivers treatment programs for students receiving individualized Applied Behavior Analysis services.
* Provides individual, group, integrated, and consultative intervention sessions for students who are eligible for Applied Behavior Analysis services.
* Provides parent training for eligible families.
* Maintains close liaison with the child study team and other related service providers.
* Keeps those records necessary for each student and completes all required local, state and federal reports.
* Maintains data for behavior change procedures and makes data based treatment decisions.
* Participates in the development and improvement of opportunities for disabled/exceptional students by providing individual or group in-service experiences for staff and parents.
* Conducts ongoing evaluation of all students in the program to determine appropriateness of their program.
* Acts as educational consultant to classroom teachers, school counselors and administrators as required.
* Assumes primary responsibility for requisitioning and maintaining needed equipment and supplies.
* Maintains professional competence through in-service education and other professional growth activities.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* Board Certified Behavior Analysis Certification.
* Demonstrate comprehensive knowledge in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis.
* Ability to effectively apply the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis to assess, treat, and monitor challenging behaviors.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Proof of recent TB screening.
* Required criminal history background check and proof of U.S. citizenship or legal resident alien status.

title: Athletic Trainer
description:
Performance Sports Center (PSC) is a premier sports facility dedicated to helping athletes reach their full potential. We provide top-tier sports training programs, camps, and leagues for athletes of all ages. As we continue to grow, we are looking for a passionate and qualified Athletic Trainer to join our team.

**Position Overview:**

We are seeking a dedicated and certified **Athletic Trainer** to support athletes across various sports programs. The Athletic Trainer (AT) will practice their profession within the parameters of their state AT license bylaws and will follow both the **Standards of Practice** and **Code of Ethics** set forth by the **National Athletic Trainers Association (NATA)** and the **Board of Certification (BOC)**. These duties, outlined below, reflect the needs of PSC and, and should not be considered all-inclusive. The Athletic Training Leadership team may modify the duties as needed.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Provide on-site coverage at sporting events, practices, and training sessions.
* Assess, diagnose, and treat sports-related injuries in real-time.
* Design and implement rehabilitation programs for injured athletes.
* Educate athletes on injury prevention techniques and wellness practices.
* Maintain accurate records of injuries and treatments.
* Collaborate with coaches, athletes, and medical professionals to ensure a safe playing environment.
* Assist in the implementation of strength and conditioning programs.
* Ensure compliance with state regulations and AT best practices.

**Qualifications:**

* **Required:** Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Athletic Training or related field.
* **Certification:** Must hold a valid **Board of Certification (BOC)** for Athletic Trainers.
* **State License:** Must be licensed or eligible for licensure in NJ.
* Knowledge of injury prevention, treatment, and rehabilitation protocols.
* Strong communication and organizational skills.
* Ability to work flexible hours, including nights and weekends for sporting events.
* CPR and First Aid certified.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience working with youth, high school, or college athletes.
* Familiarity with various sports, including soccer, lacrosse, and other field sports.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.

Job Type: Part-time

title: Application Architect
description:
Overview:  


**Role Purpose**


*The purpose of the role is to create exceptional and detailed architectural application design and provide thought leadership and enable delivery teams to provide exceptional client engagement and satisfaction.*


**Do**

  



* **Develop architectural application for the new deals/ major change requests in existing deals**

	+ *Creates an enterprise-wide architecture that ensures systems are scalable, reliable, and manageable.*

	+ *Manages application assets and directs the development efforts within an enterprise to improve solution delivery and agility*

	+ *Guides how to construct and assemble application components and services to support solution architecture and application development*
	+ *Maintains the frameworks and artefacts used in the implementation of an application, with reference to the systematic architecture of the overall application portfolio*

	+ *Responsible for application architecture paradigms such as service-oriented architecture (SOA) and, more specifically, microservices, ensuring business achieve agility and scalability for a faster time to market*

	+ *Provide solution of RFP’s received from clients and ensure overall design assurance*
	
		- Develop a direction to manage the portfolio of to-be-solutions including systems, shared infrastructure services, applications in order to better match business outcome objectives
	
		- Analyse technology environment, enterprise specifics, client requirements to set a collaboration design framework/ architecture
* Depending on the client’s need with particular standards and technology stacks create complete RFPs

* Provide technical leadership to the design, development and implementation of custom solutions through thoughtful use of modern technology

title: FT & PT Direct Support Professional (DSP)
description:
***Full Time and PT DSP positions available - weekends too!***

**On-demand pay available -** ***Work today, get paid today!***

**Ready to join our 4,000+ employees in a career at YAI?**

Working at YAI means effecting real change in people's lives. It means going home at the end of the day knowing you have helped someone accomplish a goal. If you want a career supporting others, creatively finding solutions to life's challenges, and building a more inclusive community, YAI is the place for you!

We are hiring people for our locations. The ideal candidate should possess a wide range of skills and are eager to promote YAI's mission of supporting people with intellectual and developmental disabilities to live, love, work, and learn at our **Ronkonkoma, Holbrook and Medford** programs within their communities.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* To provide direct care services as needed. This includes, but is not limited to, the provision of counseling, training in ADLs (Assisted Daily Living skills), assistance with personal care, medical, dietary, social, sexual, recreational, financial, habilitative and other needs within the program.
* Ensure the health, safety, and wellness of the people we support.
* Build and maintain positive relationships.
* Assist the people we support in maximizing their strengths, interests, and abilities through teaching, self-advocacy, and emotional support.
* Facilitate community integration, recreational activities, and socialization.

**Qualifications and Requirements:**

· High School Diploma or GED

· Work or life experience in the I/DD field is a plus but not mandatory

· Ability to complete three to five weekdays of paid New York State-mandated OPWDD training during normal business hours

· Tuberculosis (TB) testing is mandatory for most positions (and is provided free of charge by our partnership with CityMD)

· Driver's license required for majority of locations

**Schedule:**

Full Time/Part Time weekday and weekend positions are available including morning, evening, and overnight schedules.

**Full-time positions:**

title: Service Customer Care Rep
description:
**Company Description:**

  



Crown Equipment Corporation, one of the world's largest lift truck manufacturers, offers local support on a global scale with more than 15 manufacturing facilities worldwide and more than 500 retail locations in over 80 countries. Our global sales and service network provides our customers with a local resource for a wide variety of quality material handling equipment, fleet management solutions, warehouse products and support services to meet their needs anytime, anywhere.

**Responsibilities:**

* Process incoming calls from both Crown customers and Service Technicians
* Dispatch technicians
* Enter technician payroll hours
* Process parts and service billing
* Create daily work orders
* Maintain records and files
* Assist other departments as needed

 **Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Excellent phone skills
* Good communication, organizational, math and computer skills
* Experience with Microsoft Office
* Leadership skills, technical experience and knowledge a plus
* Ability to multitask

 **Work Authorization:**

  

Crown will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

  

No agency calls please.

 **Compensation and Benefits:**

  

Crown offers an excellent wage and benefits package for full-time employees. Current benefits being offered include:


* Competitive Wages. The anticipated starting pay range for the position is **$23 to $25** but is commensurate with skills and related experience,
* Health/Dental/Vision/Prescription Drug Plan with a company contribution to each,
* Health Savings Accounts and Flexible Spending Accounts,
* 401K Retirement Savings Plan: Crown matches 100% of the first 4% of your eligible pay you contribute to the plan. You are always 100% vested in the company matching contributions.
* Company paid Life and Disability Benefits as well as optional supplemental term life insurance offerings,
* Paid Parental Leave,
* 9 Paid Holidays,
* Paid Vacation accrued at a rate based on length of service and position,
* Birthday Pay for Non-Exempt employees,
* Tuition Reimbursement up to $5,250 per calendar year,
* and much more.

  

EO/AA Employer Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
***URGENTLY HIRING***

***Front Desk Medical Receptionist / Office Assistant***

*NEED TO BE FLUENT IN WRITING AND SPEAKING SPANISH*

**PLEASE COMPLETE ONLINE ASSESSMENT TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THE POSITION**

**FULL-TIME POSITION ONLY**

Looking for an additional member to join a dedicated team.

Full benefits: Health, Vision, Dential available.

Many other perks.

We are an orthopedic practice headquartered in East Rutherford, NJ with satellites in the surrounding area who are actively seeking a dedicated and highly organized **Front Desk Receptionist / Office Assistant** for a promising opportunity.

Depending on your level of experience your main task will be office administration and front desk duties.

**Responsibilities**

* Greet and welcome guests as soon as they arrive at the office
* Direct visitors to the appropriate person and office
* Answer, screen and forward incoming phone calls
* Ensure reception area is tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and material (e.g. pens, forms and brochures)
* Provide basic and accurate information in-person and via phone/email
* Receive, sort and distribute daily mail/deliveries
* Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk (monitor logbook, issue visitor badges)
* Order front office supplies and keep inventory of stock
* Update calendars and schedule meetings
* Keep updated records of office expenses and costs

**Required Skills**

* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills
* Ideally Bilingual, English and Spanish
* Good working skill with a computer
* High school diploma or equivalent
* Experience in a healthcare/clinical setting
* Strong leadership skills
* Ability to work with a strong team of professionals in a culturally diverse environment
* Ability to multitask and work/function in a fast-paced environment

**Ideal Candidate:**

* An individual that MUST be a happy, personable, and nice person
* A person that understands that, above all, service to the patient is key
* Is thoughtful and understanding of patients concerns, fears, and hesitancy in needing surgical care
* A person who works very well with others
* High-energy, dynamic individual with a focus on excellent service to patients
* Enjoys the team atmosphere
* A person who is on-time, honest, and hardworking

title: Real Estate Team Member
description:
### **Summary**

### **Advance Your Real Estate Career**


Embark on a transformative journey as a Real Estate Agent and join the elite 20% of professionals in North America. We provide a clear roadmap to success, featuring tried-and-true models, systems, and tools, along with extensive coaching, training, and robust accountability structures. Your ambition and commitment will open doors to numerous opportunities.


By becoming part of our team, you will not only elevate your career but also enjoy a range of benefits, including revenue sharing, comprehensive health plans, growth share, vesting options, and lucrative investment opportunities. Start your rewarding real estate career with us today.

### **Responsibilities**

* Graduate from Team Launch Program
* Execute Team lead generations systems weekly
* Consult with buyers, convert with signed buyer agreements and identify homes
* Negotiate offers on behalf of your sellers and buyers
* Track tasks and activities in Team Technology Platform
* Conduct two open houses monthly
* Convert prospecting and lead generation activities to appointments
* Participate in weekly script practice per team standards
* Participate in team activities per team standards
* Commit to weekly 1:1 coaching session, weekly trainings and Partner Call
* Consult with sellers, convert to listings and market home
* Demonstrate expertise on pricing strategies, staging and other listing related services

### **Qualifications**


You are an intrinsically motivated sales professional with a competitive spirit. You are excellent at building rapport, listening to the needs of others and identifying solutions. Prospecting and lead generation are your strength zones. Overcoming objections comes naturally. You are a strong communicator and committed to service.

* Team player
* Licensed real estate professional
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Learning based, growth-minded
* Organized
* Willingness to learn scripts and dialogues
* Excellent time management skills
* Must have Real Estate License

### **About-our-team**


The Vincent Koo Team believes that everyone deserves a professional by their side during a Real Estate transaction. We believe that having a professional representing you can not only save you, time and money but also give you a better overall experience.


The Vincent Koo Team is a Mega Team Covering NYC's 5 Boroughs and Long Island. Our Team is made up of the most ACTIVE local agents with the largest inventory of EXCLUSIVE LISTINGS and a proven track record of SATISFIED CLIENTS.


We are powered by PLACE, a business services and technology platform transforming the industry for top agents and their customers. Join and gain in-house marketing and design services, daily live professional development opportunities, superior technology that eliminates up to 75% of daily tasks, and more. We invest in your future by providing opportunities for personal and professional growth, so you can dream bigger while gaining exponential leverage and success within our powered by PLACE team.

title: Sanitation Manager
description:
ASR Group is the world’s largest refiner and marketer of cane sugar, with an annual production capacity of more than 6 million tons of sugar. The company produces a full line of grocery, industrial, food service and specialty sweetener products. Across North America, ASR Group owns and operates six sugar refineries, located in Louisiana, New York, California, Maryland, Canada and Mexico. In the European Union, the company owns and operates sugar refineries in England, Portugal. ASR Group also owns and operates mills in Mexico and Belize. The company’s brand portfolio includes the leading brands Domino®, C&H®, Redpath®, Tate & Lyle®, Lyle’s® and Sidul®.

  

**OVERVIEW**

  

The Sanitation Manager directs and coordinates the execution of activities related to the cleaning and sanitizing of the facility and on-site equipment at the Refinery. Conducts all aspects of job duties in a safe and responsible manner. Partners with other department Managers to establish a defined cleaning frequency, training, work instructions, and through verification activities ensures the effectiveness of the facility sanitation program.

 **DETAILED ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* Coordinates and executes the cleaning of equipment and work areas.
* Manages both cleaning contractors and cleaning employees at the facility
* Inspects premises for unsanitary practices and conditions. Compiles required reports regarding regular inspections, sanitation violations, and steps taken to resolve deficiencies.
* Manages sanitation preventive maintenance program
* Reviews and oversees the Plant Sanitation Program, including working with Cleaning and Sanitation Chemical supplier(s) to determine best cleaning and sanitizing agents and methods for maintaining Company and Regulatory cleaning and sanitizing standards.
* Completes associated documentation in a complete, accurate and timely manner.
* Conducts investigations and root cause analysis on any customer complaints and quality issues pertaining to potential sanitation issues.
* Confers with management, Quality Assurance, Safety and production personnel on sanitation problems, and recommends changes in equipment, plant layout, lighting, ventilation, or work practices to improve sanitation standards and purity of product.
* Ensures GMP's are always met
* Other job duties as assigned.

 **REQUIRED EXPERIENCE**

  

* Ability to work well under pressure and in a fast-paced environment.
* Able to be trusted with high sensitive and confidential information.
* Strong interpersonal skills - ability to work independently and as a member of various teams and committees
* Proficient on Microsoft Office applications and software programs used in the workplace
* Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all organizational levels.
* Two to four years related experience or equivalent in manufacturing environment (food industry preferred)
* Five or more years of proven accomplishments in the supervision of employees, including training, coaching, and team building

 **REQUIRED EDUCATION**

  

* Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline from an accredited college/university is required or equivalent experience

 **MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY**

  

* Responsible for training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems
* Coordinates Company Cleaning Schedule activities
* Full participation during food safety audits

title: Front Desk Receptionist- NAIL SALON
description:
We are looking for a Salon Receptionist to act as the first point of contact for customers who visit our salon or contact us to learn about our beauty services.

Salon Receptionist responsibilities include greeting customers upon their arrival, answering clients’ questions about services via phone, email or in person and processing transactions. To be successful in this role, you should be highly organized and able to manage clients with grace, even during peak demand.

Ultimately, you will help boost our reputation by building friendly, trusting relationships with customers.

Responsibilities:

* Reliably arrive to work on time and at day/times scheduled.
* Warmly greet clients, walk them to the proper beauty station and inform assigned beauticians of their arrival.
* Book and confirm appointments via phone and email.
* Process transactions (cash and credit cards) and issue receipts.
* Offer beverages and chat with clients who are in the waiting area.
* Welcome walk-ins, answer questions about services and schedule appointments based on availability.
* Inform clients about new services and discounts.
* Cross-sell services and products when appropriate (e.g. through informative brochures and gift cards).
* Answer phone calls.
* Maintain a tidy reception area.

Requirements:

title: Furniture & Mattress Sales Representative
description:
Commission based pay offering uncapped earning potential!!

No sales experience necessary!

Looking for full time and part time Sales Representatives for our Green Brook location!

Love where you work! At Value City Furniture, we take pride in giving our guests the very best experience when they shop with us. With a warm greeting and a big smile, every day is an opportunity to turn first time shoppers into loyal, life-long customers!

Our Sales teams stride to give our guests an honest, low pressure, and satisfying shopping experience. We thoroughly enjoy helping our guests fulfill their home furnishing and bedding needs!

We are looking to expand our team of positive, ambitious employees!

We recognize and appreciate all of our employee’s hard work and dedication. As a Sales Representative you will have unlimited earnings potential comprised of a lucrative commission structure, bonuses, company-wide acknowledgement & appreciation luncheons for top performers, along with other incentives.

We offer 4 full weeks of paid hands on training. After that, be prepared for the pathway to earning between $42,000 and $80,000+ annually!

If you're goal driven, motivated by money and interested in a job where you are compensated for all of the hard work you put in, then this fast paced environment is the right fit for you!

**Job Responsibilities and Requirements**

* Greet and engage with customers to uncover their home furnishing and bedding needs by helping their visions become a reality
* Provide exceptional customer service and an unforgettable shopping experience that encourages the guest to purchase with us today and come back again for future needs
* Build rapport with customers with your extensive product and inventory knowledge
* Follow up with customers throughout the process and stay in close communication with updates on their order up until delivery
* Gain knowledge of procedures and policies that foster an environment of structure and respect among peers in the workplace
* Maintain a “Team-Player” mentality at all times through positivity, and rapport with both the customer and coworkers
* Meet/exceed goals set by management
* Take part in company-wide training sessions that are both informative and fun
* Must be able to travel to other locations for training

**Full Time Schedule Expectations**

Scheduled to work a minimum of 40 hours per week including Saturdays and Sundays; the number of hours worked will increase during holidays or blackout periods, or for coverage needs.

Scheduled for two days off each week, except during holidays or blackout periods.

* Life Insurance
* 401(K) Matching
* Paid Vacation
* PTO
* Employee Discount
* Flexible Schedule

**Part Time Schedule Expectations**

Scheduled to work a minimum of 20 hours a week. Must work one weekend day/night and one full 8 hour shift. Must work Holidays and when coverage is needed the most.

Must work 30 hours a week for health benefits. Must work 40 hours a week to be eligible for Dental, Vision and 401k.

* PTO
* Employee Discount
* Flexible Schedule

title: Warehouse Customer Service Representative (Seasonal)
description:
**WAREHOUSE CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE**

  


**Shift/Schedule**


* Monday - Friday, 7:30AM - 4:00PM

  



Text **DELIVER** to **88300** to apply or check out more jobs at ***www.workatGEODIS.com***!

  


**GEODIS** specializes in unlocking business value in a complex world, ensuring seamless movement of goods worldwide. As a global third-party logistics provider (3PL), we power *A* ***Better Way to Deliver*** for the world's top brands and manufacturers. Fuel your career with **GEODIS** and discover endless growth opportunities.

  



Look what you’ll get by joining the **GEODIS** team!


* **Get Good Money** – Fair pay and some jobs come with bonus opportunities.
* **Get the Right Job/Right Schedule** – Part-time, full-time, seasonal – days, nights, weekends, and even gig work. We have the job and shift you want.\\*
* **Get Paid Early** – Payday as early as you want. Access your earnings on demand.
* **Get Free Healthcare** – Access to telemedicine from day 1 at no cost. Other benefit options include healthcare, dental, and vision at affordable costs after a short waiting period.\\*
* **Get a Break** – Paid holidays, time off, short-term disability, and new parent leave are a few of the ways we support time away from work to take care of your life.\\*
* **Stay Safe** – We pride ourselves on a safe, clean, and healthy work environment for everyone.
* **Get a Voice** – We are always asking our teammates to tell us how to make their experience working at **GEODIS** even better.
* **Get Promoted** – When you are ready to take the next step in your career, we will be there to support you. We promote about 10% of our warehouse workers each year.
* **Get a Boost** – Our "**GEODIS** Compassion Fund" makes one-time grants to teammates who have experienced unexpected catastrophes.
* **Get Involved** – Volunteer in your community or donate to the "**GEODIS** Foundation" or "**GEODIS** Compassion Fund".
* **Have FUN** – Work with fun, supportive people just like you!
* **Find Your Place** – We value diversity and seek to provide an inclusive culture. Join an Employee Resource Group, participate in an international lunch, or celebrate your heritage to find your place of belonging.
* **Find Your Future** – Whether you are interested in the opportunity to work seasonally or looking to launch your career, **GEODIS** is the place!


* *Eligibility varies based on location, job, employee type, or length of service.*

  


**What you will be doing:**


* Interacts with customers by phone, email, or in person and receives orders or changes in service.
* Adjusts complaints concerning billing or service rendered, referring complaints of service failures to designated departments for investigation.
* Processes and inputs all customer orders and receipts. Runs stock reports to check for product availability.
* Generates all related paperwork and necessary information required for customer work orders, checks all orders for special requests, and posts inventory records.
* Coordinates special, last minute shipping requests with the transportation departments, expediting orders, as necessary.
* Traces orders as required and notifies customers of any activity concerning their merchandise, including shipping and tracing information.
* Assures proper invoicing of accounts by verifying computer generated invoices.
* Maintains a good working relationship with customers by responding to all inquiries and complaints concerning receipts, invoices, shipments, inventory counts, etc., in a courteous and efficient manner.
* Reports customer feedback to management, including any signs of customer dissatisfaction.
* Acts as liaison between the warehouse and the customer in administration of accounts and between the office and customer regarding invoicing and credit changes
* Performs paperwork associated with orders including the maintenance of customer files.
* Performs clerical work as required including answering phone calls, operating various office machines and computers, corresponding with customers, and greeting customers and visitors in the office.
* Maintains current and accurate procedure book which details the processing requirements for each account; prepares any report concerning customer services activities and performs other customer service and company related duties, as necessary.
* Notifies management of all requested changes from the customer regarding shipping, handling, or administrative characteristics
* Works with management regarding product routing for customers
* For food accounts, incumbent is responsible to report food safety problems to senior management to initiate action.

  


**Requirements:**


* Minimum 6 months related experience and/or training
* Experience with AS400 operating systems and warehouse management systems preferred.
* PC literate with experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word, and Excel
* Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals.
* Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, customers, and co-workers.
* Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

  



The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.

  



Job Duties as documented in this job description are considered “Essential Functions” and have been created by the standards of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC). The standards of the Americans with Disabilities Act (1990) require that employees be able to perform “Essential Functions” of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the “Essential Functions”.

  


**More about GEODIS**


**GEODIS** is a global third-party logistics provider (3PL for short) powering the supply chains of some of the top brands and manufacturers. Our legacy of excellence in supply chain solutions spans decades. Come find your future with us as we shape the future of logistics. Visit ***www.workatGEODIS.com*** to learn more.

title: Wastewater Treatment Plant Operator
description:
**Job Overview:**

We are seeking Wastewater Operators to join our team. As an Operator, you will be responsible for operating and maintaining all segments of the Hanover Sewerage Authority Wastewater Treatment Plant.

**Job Duties:**

* Operations & Maintenance: Safely operate and maintain prescribed wastewater equipment according to schedule. Includes tanks, pumps, motors, etc.
* Recording & Calculations: Log all maintenance records in your assigned area. Record and calculate daily readings.
* Line Maintenance: Perform sewer taps, operate sewer jet, enter manholes and other confined spaces, inspect sewer lines, and maintain proper inspection records.
* Laboratory Sampling and Testing: Perform sampling and testing of parameters required as deemed necessary by the plant superintendent.
* General Housekeeping: Keep your assigned areas clean, and help in areas assigned by supervisors.
* Weekend scheduled work/Emergencies: Operators are required to work scheduled weekend and holidays and perform emergency work as deemed necessary by the plant superintendent.

**Accountability:**

After the initial training has been completed, the treatment plant operator will be held accountable for knowledge of all safety procedures required, which include the following: Emergency response Procedures, All HSA and OSHA safety programs, and other specific safe job procedures.

* Personnel are also required to respond to emergency calls on a 24-hour basis.
* Personnel must quality for HSA Respiratory Program for entrance into confined spaces and Emergency Hazardous Substance Response.

**Qualifications:**

Education Requirements: High School graduate

Experience: Employment in wastewater treatment system preferred but not required. Experience in operation, maintenance and repair of mechanical and electrical equipment required.

Commercial Driver’s License: Class B CDL license with N Endorsement or willing to obtain CDL is required.

Respiratory Training/Clearance: Must have medical clearance for and be able to use a respirator for confined space or emergency response operations.

**Physical Demands:**

Medium to heavy work; involving climbing, balancing, stooping, kneeling, crouching, reaching, handling, fingering, talking, hearing, visual acuity, depth perception, and color vision.

The tasks typically involve climbing ladders multiple times per day, climbing stairs multiple times per day, entering and climbing in manholes on a regular basis, lifting weights of fifty (50) pounds on a daily basis and one hundred (100) pounds + on a regular basis, removing and reinstalling manhole covers, pushing and moving objects using appropriate equipment with weights up to 500 pounds, stooping, kneeling or crouching to perform operational and maintenance activities, operating overhead equipment such as valves with an operating force of up to fifty (50) pounds.

Join us and be part of a dynamic team where your skills will be valued and developed. Apply now to start your career as an Operator!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $30.00 per hour

License/Certification:

* Public Wastewater Collection System (C License) (Required)
* Public Wastewater Treatment System (S License) (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Seasonal Haunted House Ambassador
description:
**The Role**  

Liberty Science Center (LSC) seeks enthusiastic customer service talent to work in our Haunted House experience that will run from September 23-November 3. Ideal candidates will feel at ease entertaining and scaring teen and adult guests in a Haunted House. (Please note there will be no physical contact with our guests.) This role requires some combination of the following essential functions:



* Greet and welcome guests in a friendly manner as they enter the Haunted House


* Perform in a costume and makeup to scare and entertain guests (ages 13+) for 7 or more hours


* Pop out of scare spots or entertain guests in the queue


* Manage large crowds in queues calmly and efficiently


* Review rules with guests and keep the flow of people running smoothly


* Assist guests while in the experience by providing direction, enforcing restrictions, and addressing safety concerns


* Serve as an advocate for guests while simultaneously promoting the interests of LSC, by communicating with a variety of diverse guests to ensure a positive museum experience and resolving visitors’ concerns and complaints to their satisfaction and LSC’s


* Oversee and monitor the condition, presentation, and safety of the Haunted House and assist in the preparation and closing of all public spaces relating to the Haunted House



Seasonal Haunted House Ambassadors report to the Senior Manager of Guest Experience.  

  

**What You’ll Bring**  

You have a theatrical personality and love entertaining others. Charismatic, energetic, and friendly, your customer-service focus and positivity drive our goalto continuously improve what our guests experience at Liberty Science Center. Along with yourcustomer service expertise, you:

* Enjoy speaking in public and getting to know our guests


* Have performing abilities


* Take initiative and are quick to solve problems and offer creative solutions
* Work well within a team-based setting
* Comfortable working in a “scary” loud environment and navigating small, dark spaces


* Possess strong judgment- you make decisions that keep the guest experience in mind and know when it is appropriate to refer to a supervisor
* Uphold a consistently high level of enthusiasm and energy whether it is a busy or slow day


* Thrive in an ever-changing, high-energy environment and demonstrate flexibility by following directions and adjusting to changing policies and procedures
  

  

**Role Expectations**  

The Haunted House Ambassador is required to:



* Set the standard for others by having **stellar attendance, being reliable, and providing exceptional guest engagement**

	+ Be present and on time for all of your scheduled shifts from September 23 to November 3, 2024

	+ Conduct work with a positive and professional attitude
	+ Contribute to a positive team-based culture
	+ Follow all LSC and departmental policies and procedures

	+ Assist with upholding safety protocols and cleaning
**Desired Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSAs)**



* Acting skills


* Ability to work in a high-paced and crowded environment


* Applied knowledge of superior guest experience standards


* Strong teaming and collaboration skills
* Exceptional communication and de-escalation skills
* Creative and resourceful problem-solving skills


* Ability to work well as a team member or independently
  

  

**Classification & Schedule**  

The Haunted House Ambassador is a position that offers an opportunity to work a part-time schedule for a temporary period of time, specifically from September 23-November 3.**You must be available to work every weekend and Thursday evenings in addition to October 14th and the evenings of October 9th and October 25th during the seasonal period.** Shifts may range from 5-8 hours in duration.


This role is non-exempt, meaning it is eligible for overtime for work that exceeds 40 hours in LSC’s standard work week which runs from Saturday to Friday. All overtime must be approved in advance by the supervisor.  

  

**Compensation**  

The Haunted House Ambassador is compensated at a rate of $17.50/hour. Liberty Science Center also provides perks for all eligible part-time employees, including:



* 25% staff discount in the LSC store


* 15% discount in the onsite cafe
* LSC Membership


* Earned paid sick time


* Free parking



**Physical/Environmental Demands**  

*The physical requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.*  

  

While performing the duties of this job, the employee must be able to stand, scream, and wear a mask for long periods of time. The ability to lift and carry 30 pounds is required during the breakdown of the Haunted House. The position requires the ability to walk on concrete floors, climb stairs, bend/lift/stretch, tolerate high levels of noise and flashing lights, navigate crowds, and publicly speak. While working in costume you will be exposed to latex.  

  

**Our Culture & Benefits**  

Liberty Science Center prides itself on fostering a culture that enables all employees to experience a sense of pleasure, passion, and purpose while in the workplace. We believe in embracing and driving change, inspiring fun and learning, and creating a positive and family-friendly team spirit. Our differences as individuals (race, gender, age, cultural heritage, physical ability, education, and lifestyle) are an asset and contribute to our ability to drive innovation. Lastly, at the heart of our work culture is the commitment to delivering a “wow factor” through our exceptional customer service to not only our guests but also one another.  

  

**Travel**  

This position requires no travel.  

  

**To apply:**  

Please submit a cover letter highlighting why this role is a good fit for you, and complete the required questions (on the LSC Careers Page).

title: Group Leader, After School Program
description:
**Group Leader**

**Job Type:** Part-time

**Pay rate:** $18.50 per hour

**Expected hours:** 20 hours per week

**Schedule:** After School Monday to Friday

**Experience:** After-school Program: 2 years (Required)

**Language:** Bilingual (Required)

**Ability to Commute:**  Brooklyn, NY 11201

**Work Location:** In person

**Job description duties**

As a Group Leader, you will facilitate and lead various activities in STEM, arts, and physical recreation. Specialists will be asked to develop and execute lesson plans in their respective specialized enrichment activities. You are also expected to ensure a safe recreational environment for our scholars by exercising classroom management principles. Specialists will work closely with their coworkers, counselors, and the Program Director to connect after-school learning opportunities to the real world through trips, take-home projects, and other activities.

Specialists are expected to align with the school-day culture of discipline and community by upholding school-day rules and regulations and adhering to any staff regulations. Activity Specialists must be available to work 2 PM to 6:30 PM Monday through Friday, as well as 9-5 PM on days when there is no school for Holiday camp programming.

To create this kind of vibrant learning community, we invest in our faculty by providing ongoing professional training and support. We encourage our educators to collaborate closely and push each other to achieve great outcomes.

You will oversee and manage a group of students in an educational setting. Your duties will include:

* Creating and implementing age-appropriate activities and lesson plans
* Providing guidance and supervision to students
* Assisting with homework and educational assignments
* Promoting positive behavior and enforcing discipline when necessary
* Monitoring the safety and well-being of students at all times
* Collaborating with other staff members to ensure a smooth and efficient operation
* Communicating with parents/guardians regarding student progress and any concerns

**Skills**

To excel in this role, you should possess the following skills:

* Experience working with students in +childcare, or educational setting
* Knowledge of early childhood education principles and practices
* Ability to educate and engage students in various subjects and activities
* First aid certification or willingness to obtain one
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Ability to multitask and handle challenging situations with patience and professionalism
* Previous experience in babysitting, childhood development, or sports coaching is a plus

This position offers an opportunity to positively impact young students' lives while working in a supportive and collaborative environment. If you are passionate about working with children and possess the necessary skills, we encourage you to apply for the Group Leader position.

*CCM is an Equal Opportunity employer. Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at CCM. At CCM employment is based upon merit and qualifications. Our policy of Equal Employment Opportunity applies to all policies and procedures relating to recruitment and hiring, compensation, benefits, termination and all other terms and conditions of employment.*

title: Marketing & Transaction Coordinator
description:
Join a team of awesome agents and a powerhouse “Back of House” team to support a team of sales agents in their day-to-day business transactions. 80% work from home until further notice. This role is a great opportunity to understand the workings of a highly successful real estate agent/team in NYC. The experience gained will be industry-leading. Rewarding compensation and growth potential is offered to the right candidate.

 **Compensation:**

* Salary Range: $70,000 - $80,000
* Paid Time Off
* Bonus Opportunity

 **The Compelling Future:**

* Work with the #1 team in Brooklyn of the #1 Company in the country!
* Work for the fastest growing and most innovative real estate companies in the US (and soon to be the world) - Compass
* Performance-Based Additional Bonus Structure
* Growth Opportunities
* Paid vacation, company outings, and other perks
* Consistent and Innovative Professional & Personal Business Development
* Professional & personal 1 on 1 coaching/mentorship with the Founder of The Litvak Team
* A culture of performance and people - a team completely dedicated to supporting each other both at work and out of the office. The Litvak team is a family!
* Be a part of cutting-edge technology, strategies, innovation, and the re-invention of how modern-day real estate is practiced

**Compensation:**
$70,000 - $80,000 yearly

**Responsibilities:**
Support agents in their day-to-day role/s with tasks related to the sales listing/buyer process including but not limited to:

* Creating listing agreements, coordinating signatures, and sending them to the listings department
* Coordinating with management companies to build due diligence documents
* Entering new listings into listing distribution systems, StreetEasy, and uploading all media
* Point person on overseeing coop/condo Board Packages (w/ help of a board package 3rd party)
* Contacting management for any building/unit questions from customers
* Updating listings online for price drops, status changes, etc.
* Facilitating deal sheets and necessary info for accepted offers
* Tracking contracts and following up with attorneys
* Coordinating interviews and closings when buyer applications are approved
* Sending out commission bills and payment instructions to attorneys
* Submitting expenses for marketing reimbursements
* Lead and execute upon the marketing efforts (Social Media, Email newsletters, mailers, show sheets) required for sales listing/buyer pipeline - you will also be managing/working with a marketing specialist
* Run point on the execution of sales listing activities (photography scheduling, staging, advertising)
* Own the data accuracy of our industry-leading CRM (via Hubspot) relating to the sales pipelines (we have plenty of automation that will automatically inform you of tasks)
* Vet new referral opportunities for the sales agents
* Analyzing and presenting comps (mostly for appraisals)
* Managing our project management systems (Asana & Hubspot) effectively to ensure all tasks are completed
* Work with the “back of house” team and outside vendors and stakeholders
* Introduce potential new agents to the team leader (recruiting bonus opportunity)

**Qualifications:****Core Competencies**

* Efficient Response Times (< 1hr Slack & < 3hr email)
* Ability to multitask & prioritize
* Ability to thrive in a high-paced environment
* Excellent time mgmt skills
* Experience with CRM & project management software
* High level of attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills
* Experience working with multiple agents/transactions simultaneously

 **Qualifications & Requirements**

* NY Real Estate license is a plus but not essential. If you meet the other requirements of the role - we want to hear from you!
* 2 years of sales support experience
* Knowledge of Google Suite
* Knowledge of Sales Process (buyer & listing)
* Knowledge of the Mortgage Process
* Knowledge of Board Packager
* Team player attitude
* Always act in a professional manner
* leadership, behavior, attitude, and dress
* Acts in the best interest of the company
* Adhere to TLT values
* Leadership style driven by empathy & understanding
* High Energy, Solutions Driven, Personable
* Knowledge of Hubspot
* Knowledge of Asana
* Knowledge of Slack
* Knowledge of Keynote / Powerpoint
* Experience in personal development and/or business coaching (Tony Robbins, Tom Ferry, Brian Buffini, Ninja Selling, etc.)

**About Company**  

Join our dynamic Compass Real Estate Team in New York! We are a group of passionate professionals dedicated to helping clients navigate the city's real estate market with confidence. Backed by Compass's innovative tools and a commitment to excellence, we provide top-notch service and personalized experiences. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and love all things real estate, join us today!

title: Client Service Representative I - SSL
description:
Job Responsibilities and Requirements
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES*\\*other duties as assigned\\**
This role serves as the main contact for the client/policyholder and agent/broker for ongoing service and is their resource for plan structure, renewal questions, policy issues, and other administrative aspects of their plan. This role has entry level knowledgeable about SSLICNY procedures and NYS WCB regulations.
Account Management* Limited knowledge of NYS WCB regulations as they affect our business and client issues, and client needs; Works with manager to increase knowledge in NYS WCB regulations thus building and maintaining positive ongoing client relationships.
* Provides continual education to clients on Standard Security processes, policies, and procedures, including web-site services and navigation.
* Responds to customer inquiries regarding coverage questions, billing issues, status updates, and other aspects of the benefit plans with oversight from manager and Sr. team members when needed.
* Works closely with resolution specialists in billing, and other internal departments to facilitate smooth operational functions. Must maintain thorough knowledge of all service activities associated with assigned clients. Must present complete understanding of all issues to client, with support of manager and Sr. team members, to ensure a seamless client experience.
* Addresses inbound/outgoing calls providing customer service to policyholders, employees, and brokers with oversight from manager. The manager may also participate in the calls to support training/ensure a positive customer experience.
* New business application coding and processing into our database (PolicyNet).
* Communicates information in terms callers will understand.
* Follows up on customer inquiries when needed.
* Resolves a wide variety of questions and inquiries for our customers. Manger will provide support when needed.
* Maintaining adherence to all department standards (policies, procedures, schedules, and assignments)
* Manage assigned agency book(s) of business and relationship with said entity and their clients.
* Responsible and accountable for maintaining and protecting confidential employer and producer information.
* Must maintain a high level of confidentiality and abide by NYS Data Encryption rules and regulations
* Electronic filing of supporting documents for policy changes
* Helps to maintains account management database (PolicyNet) for assigned clients.
* Supports Client and Broker reporting requests (PolicyNet, Access, SSL Website).
* Facilitates website new user access and troubleshoots user issues.
* Performs other duties and responsibilities, as assigned.
* Special projects as needed.


Administrative* Utilizes best practices and follows standard operating procedures. Also, identifies internal process, policy, procedure, or technology issues that may be adversely impacting client satisfaction. Works with Regional Service Manager to identify and implement solutions.
* Contributes to and participates in departmental and organization-wide projects and committees designed to enhance service, improve efficiency, and improve knowledge.
* May be responsible for New Producer set-up, ensuring accurate information in internal systems


REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, COMPETENCIES, AND/OR RELATED EXPERIENCE*\\*or equivalent experience gained from any combination of formal education, on-the-job training, and/or work and life experience\\**
Required Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and/or Related Experience* High School Diploma required
* Related experience preferred
* Demonstrated exceptional customer service acumen, strong consulting/negotiation/leadership skills
* Product/maintenance knowledge (including plan designs, funding, banking, etc.) with a high degree of operational effectiveness preferred.
* Strong communication skills, written and verbal
* Ability to build and maintain collaborative working relationships at all levels
* Planning and organization skills, multi-tasking
* Proven analytical skills
* Ability to prioritize incoming customer queries and maintain the RSL responsiveness commitment
* Ability to adapt to change
* PC skills using MS Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook)
* Knowledge of group insurance, products, contracts, and services preferred
* Understanding of state regulations applying to group plans preferred
* Knowledge of underwriting principles and practices preferred


Ability to Travel: Up to 10%  

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
When used in the description below, the following terms are defined as:
“Occasional”: done only from time to time, but necessary when it is performed
“Frequent”: regularly performed; generally an act that is required on a daily basis
“Continuous”: typically performed for the majority of an employee’s shift
Sitting for prolonged periods of time, frequently standing, walking distances up to one mile, bending, crouching, kneeling, reaching, occasionally lifting 25lbs, extensive typing, picking up and holding small objecting and otherwise using primarily the fingers rather than the entire hand. Employee is required to have visual acuity sufficient to perform activities such as preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing notes; viewing a computer terminal and extensive reading. Employee is required to have hearing sufficient to understand verbal instruction and answer telephones. Reliance Matrix will provide qualified employees with a reasonable accommodation in accordance with applicable law.
CORE VALUES* Collaboration
* Compassion
* Empowerment
* Integrity
* Fun

*The above description reflects the general details considered necessary to describe the principle responsibilities and functions of the job identified and shall not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent to this job.*  


Hiring Range: $$19.60 - $$24.50 Hourly* The hiring range listed in this posting represents the expected hiring range for work performed in the primary location (New York, NY). If this role is eligible for remote work, or will report to a different office than the one listed above, the hiring range may differ.

  

Work location may be flexible if approved by the Company.  

What We Offer
At Reliance Matrix, we believe that creating a more diverse, equitable and inclusive culture allows us to realize more of our potential. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you.
That is why we offer a competitive pay package and a range of benefits to help team members thrive in their financial, physical, and mental wellbeing.
Our Benefits:* An annual performance bonus for all team members
* Generous 401(k) company match that is immediately vested
* A choice of three medical plans (that include prescription drug coverage) to suit your unique needs. For High Deductible Health Plan enrollees, a company contribution to your Health Savings Account
* Multiple options for dental and vision coverage
* Company provided Life & Disability Insurance to ensure financial protection when you need it most
* Family friendly benefits including Paid Parental Leave & Adoption Assistance
* Hybrid work arrangements for eligible roles
* Tuition Reimbursement and Continuing Professional Education
* Paid Time Off, volunteer days, community partnerships, and Employee Assistance Program
* Ability to connect with colleagues around the country through our Employee Resource Group program and our Diversity Equity & Inclusion Council


Our Values:* Integrity
* Empowerment
* Compassion
* Collaboration
* Fun


EEO Statement
Reliance Matrix is an equal opportunity employer. We adhere to a policy of making employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship, age or disability, or any other classification or characteristic protected by federal or state law or regulation. We assure you that your opportunity for employment depends solely on your qualifications.

title: Lead Business Analyst
description:
**Company Description**  

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

 **Job Description**  

The Strategic Projects team sits in the Insurance Programs Operations (IPO) business unit of ISO. We are mainly responsible for maintaining the ratemaking systems used by our actuaries to produce advisory loss costs, and leading and contributing to highly visible, matrixed projects to both enhance and develop exciting new products and processes.


As a Lead Business Analyst on the Strategic Projects team, you will be responsible for leading ongoing operations support processes and improvement/enhancement projects on those processes, project managing cross-team initiatives, and supporting the Director in reporting and metrics.


Responsibilities:

* Lead multiple ongoing BAU processes that are staffed by our Process Improvement team in Krakow
* Develop, own, and maintain project plans and roadmaps for new and ongoing projects, including maintaining tasks using JIRA, meeting regularly with team members to check in on progress, leading the resolution of any bugs or issues, and managing stakeholder expectations and priorities
* Contribute to projects as needed, when your skillset and capacity aligns with project needs
* Build up an understanding from the technical/customer/product owner perspectives of all products supported by the Strategic Projects/Process Improvement team
* Support the Director of Strategic Projects in reporting on project status and metrics, and other ad hoc tasks to support strategic initiatives as needed

  

**Qualifications**  

* Bachelor’s degree in business information technology or related field required
* At least 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst/Associate, Project Manager, or related position required
* Strong communication and organization skills required
* Demonstrated leadership experience strongly preferred
* At least 2 years of P&C insurance/actuarial experience preferred
* Experience using project management tools such as JIRA or similar
* Experience using modern database and information system technologies
* Familiarity with data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau, Sigma, etc.
* Proficiency in SQL and Python
* Comfortable working through unclear requirements and changing priorities
* Willingness to go outside of comfort zone and learn new skills


#LI-ZP1


#LI-Hybrid

 **Additional Information**  

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.


For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.


Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale.


We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.  

  

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.  

* Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
* Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
* Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries
**Verisk Businesses**


Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision


Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences


Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient


Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.


Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance


Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement


Life Insurance Solutions – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.


Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger


At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by *Forbes* as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.


Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.


All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.
